Jack and Phil had arrived at their high school reunion, eager to catch up with old friends and reminisce about their days in the halls of the old building. As they made their way around the room, they were soon approached by Apollo, a former classmate who they hadn’t seen in years.

“Hey guys, how’s it going?” Apollo asked, grinning broadly.

“Good, good!” Phil replied. “How about you?”

“I’m doing well,” Apollo said. “So, Jack, I hear you’re still sneezing like a champion.”

Jack laughed nervously. “Yeah, I guess you could say that,” he said.

“Champion?” Phil snorted. “Try the world record holder. Jack’s sneezes have only gotten bigger.”

Apollo raised an eyebrow. “Really?”

“Oh, yeah,” Phil said. “We were at a construction site last week and Jack let out a sneeze that took down half the building.”

“Phil,” Jack said, shaking his head. “It wasn’t half the building.”

“Close enough,” Phil said, shrugging.

Apollo’s eyes widened. “Wow,” he said. “That’s incredible.”

“It’s not just incredible, it’s dangerous,” Jack said. “When I feel a sneeze coming on, it’s like a ticking time bomb in my nose. I never know what kind of destruction it’s going to cause.”

“And the worse part is,” Phil added, “you can’t stop it. Once that tickle starts, it’s over.”

“Exactly,” Jack said. “It’s like I’m a prisoner in my own body.”

Apollo looked at the two of them in amazement. “Well, is anything here going to make you sneeze?” he asked.

“Who knows?” Phil said. “But if it does, I’ll give you a heads up.”

“Thanks, Phil,” Apollo said, still looking a little stunned. “I appreciate it.”

Jack and Phil laughed as they walked away, leaving Apollo to ponder the enormity of Jack’s sneezes. They had come to terms with it, but it was still a little surreal for everyone else. But for Jack and Phil, it was just another day in the life of the unstoppable sneeze.

Write this story again but this time omit the dialogue about Jack’s feelings when he has a sneeze coming on. Include more examples from Phil about how big Jack’s sneezes can get. Write in the style of Ian McEwan.

Apollo stood in front of Jack and Phil, his arms crossed over his chest. "So, Jack," he said, "I heard you used to have quite the sneeze back in high school."

Phil laughed. "Yeah, Jack's sneezes have only gotten bigger since then. You wouldn't believe it."

Apollo raised an eyebrow. "Really? Bigger?"

Phil nodded. "Oh yeah. I mean, have you seen the destruction a Jack sneeze can cause? The man could level a building with just one sneeze."

Apollo shook his head in disbelief. "I don't think I've ever heard of sneezes being that powerful."

Phil chuckled. "Well, you better believe it. I've seen it with my own two eyes. The man can clear out a room with one sneeze. And don't even get me started on the destruction it causes on a construction site. I'm talking smashed windows, broken pipes, knocked-over walls. The list goes on."

Apollo looked at Jack, who simply shrugged. "It's true," Jack said. "I can't control it. I've tried everything."

Apollo sighed. "Well, I hope nothing here at the reunion makes you sneeze."

Phil grinned. "Don't worry, I'll give you a heads up if Jack starts to feel a sneeze coming on."

The three of them shared a laugh as they walked away, the magnitude of Jack's sneezes still fresh in their minds.

Write this chapter again in a dialogue heavy style reminiscent of Philip Roth. Include lots of examples from Phil and Apollo about what Jack’s sneezes were like in high school, and then have Phil share examples of how Jack’s sneezes have gotten much bigger since then.

Phil rubbed his chin thoughtfully as he looked over at Jack. "You remember how it was back in high school, don't you, Jack?" he asked.

"How could I forget?" Jack replied with a chuckle. "I was always getting teased for my sneezes."

Apollo nodded. "Yeah, I remember that too. Your sneezes were pretty big back then, but they couldn't compare to what they are now."

Phil nodded in agreement. "Oh yeah, Jack's sneezes have gotten way bigger since then. I remember one time when we were working on a construction site, Jack let out a sneeze that knocked over a whole wall. It was something else, let me tell you."

Apollo's eyes widened in disbelief. "You're not serious, are you?"

"Dead serious," Phil replied. "And that's just the tip of the iceberg. Jack's sneezes have only gotten bigger and more destructive as time has gone on."

"It's like he's got a ticking time bomb in his nose," Jack added with a grin.

Apollo looked from Jack to Phil and back again. "I can hardly believe it. What happens if they keep getting bigger?"

Phil shrugged. "That's a good question, Apollo. We just take it one sneeze at a time and hope for the best."

"And hope that nothing gets destroyed in the process," Jack added with a laugh.

Write a story about Jack and Phil encountering another young man with sneezes like Jack’s. Begin with Jack and Phil hearing an enormous sneeze in the distance. Phil looks over at Jack, thinking it was Jack that sneezed. Just as they realize it wasn’t Jack sneezing, they hear another colossal sneeze. They head in the direction of the sneezes. End with Jack and Phil arriving on the scene as the young man unleashes another monster sneeze. Write in the style of Neil Gaiman.

Jack and Phil were working on a construction site when they heard a mighty explosion of air, like a sonic boom. They looked around, but no one was near enough to have made the noise. Suddenly, they heard it again, another sneeze of monstrous proportions.

Phil looked at Jack, trying to figure out if it was Jack who had sneezed, but Jack shook his head. He could feel the tickle in his own nose, but he knew it wasn't him who had let out that sneeze.

"Where is that coming from?" Phil asked, his voice a mixture of curiosity and fear.

They followed the sound, walking down the street towards the source. They turned a corner and found themselves face-to-face with another young man, who was in the midst of another sneeze.

This sneeze was even bigger than the first two, causing the windows of nearby buildings to shake and rattle. The young man was holding his nose with both hands, trying to keep himself together.

Phil and Jack approached him cautiously, ready for another sneeze. But the young man only smiled sheepishly at them and apologized.

"Sorry about that," he said. "I've always had big sneezes, but they've been getting worse lately."

Jack and Phil exchanged a look of disbelief. They had never met anyone with sneezes like Jack's before. They introduced themselves and found out the young man's name was Ben.

Ben explained that he had always struggled with his sneezes, but they had gotten much worse in the last few months. He was worried that his sneezes were going to get him into trouble, or even hurt someone.

Jack and Phil listened sympathetically, telling Ben about their own experiences with giant sneezes. They all laughed about the absurdity of it all, but at the same time, they were all aware of the danger that their sneezes posed.

In the end, Jack, Phil, and Ben agreed to work together, sharing tips and tricks for managing their sneezes. They promised to look out for each other, and to always be there to help if one of them needed it.

As they walked away, Jack, Phil, and Ben laughed and joked, but they also knew that their lives would never be the same again. They were part of a small, exclusive club, the members of which all had one thing in common: sneezes that were big enough to shake the world.
That was great. Write this chapter again in the style of Cormac McCarthy. Include lots of description of the sneezes. Include a physical description of Ben.

Jack and Phil heard an ear-splitting sneeze that echoed through the air. They look at each other, both momentarily stunned. They had heard sneezes like that before, but never so powerful. They quickly realized it wasn't Jack who had let loose with such a monstrous sneeze.

The pair began to make their way towards the source of the sneezes, their curiosity piqued. Another massive sneeze echoed through the air, this one even more powerful than the first. They quicken their pace, eager to find the source of such formidable sneezes.

As they approached, they saw a young man standing in the center of a small clearing. He was of average height and build, with close-cropped hair. But it was his sneezes that drew the eye. Each one was like a sonic boom, shaking the very earth.

The young man, Ben, stood there with his eyes closed, his face contorted as another sneeze built up within him. Jack and Phil watched in awe as Ben let loose with a sneeze that was like a small explosion. They felt the ground shake beneath their feet, saw debris thrown into the air. When the dust cleared, Ben was still standing, his eyes closed, his face twisted in the aftermath of his sneeze.

Jack and Phil approached him, staring in disbelief. They had never seen anything like this before, and they had seen a lot of sneezes. Ben opened his eyes and looked at them, as if only just realizing they were there.

"Who are you guys?" he asked, his voice still shaking from his latest sneeze.

"We're Jack and Phil," Jack said. "We heard your sneezes and came to see what was going on."

"My sneezes?" Ben asked, looking at them as if they were crazy.

"Yeah, your sneezes," Phil said. "They're like nothing we've ever seen before."

Ben looked at them for a moment, then shrugged. "I've always had sneezes like this," he said. "I don't know what to do about it."

Jack and Phil exchanged a look. They knew exactly what Ben was going through. They told him about their own experiences with massive sneezes, and how they had learned to live with them.

As they spoke, another sneeze began to build within Ben. He closed his eyes, bracing himself. This time, the sneeze was even more powerful than the others. When it was over, Ben looked at them, a look of fear in his eyes.

"What am I going to do?" he asked, his voice shaking. "These sneezes are getting worse and worse."

Jack and Phil looked at each other, then back at Ben. They knew exactly what he was going through, and they were ready to help.
